meanings.definition: Not automated; not capable of operating automatically.
meanings.sent1: The nonautomated machine required manual input to function.
meanings.sent2: The factory had both automated and nonautomated production lines.
meanings.sent3: The nonautomated coffee maker seemed to have a mind of its own, always brewing at unexpected times.
meanings.sent4: Her nonautomated approach to problem-solving was like navigating a maze without a map.
meanings.sent5: The nonautomated car wash was a throwback to simpler times, with attendants hand-washing each vehicle.

meanings.definition: Not involving or performed by automatic processes.
meanings.sent1: The nonautomated system required constant monitoring by the operators.
meanings.sent2: The nonautomated payment method involved manual entry of each transaction.
meanings.sent3: The nonautomated sprinkler system had a quirky charm, with each sprinkler turning on individually.
meanings.sent4: Her nonautomated response to the email flood was like hand-delivering each message.
meanings.sent5: The nonautomated clock ticked loudly, reminding everyone of the passing time without any digital display.
